what: Plot a sample sounding for Shearwater, Nova Scotia, Canada.
title: Introduction to the atmospheric Package
text: example uses sample data file provided package, otherwise building vignette can yield error, server (Reference 1) unreachable busy return files. several errors deficiencies graph, including following. lines sloping left (curved) dry adiabats, erroneously straight reflect just near-surface lapse rate wet adiabats added water fraction added wind barbs added text summaries added Skew-T log-P sounding profile Shearwater, Nova Scotia, Canada, July 11, 2024. wider line represents temperature thinner line represents dew point. curves skewed right; read values, trace 45 degree lines horizontal axis.

title: Introduction to the atmospheric Package

title: Plot atmospheric sounding data  plot
text: sounding result call readAtmosphericSounding(). item character value indicating plot. moment, choices default, "DWPT+TEMP". legend logical value indicating whether show legend top- left corner.  FALSE default. mar 4-element numeric vector specifying margins, standard way (.e. handed par() function). default set give space height indications right margin. mgp 3-element numeric vector specifying axis spacing, usual way (.e. handed par() function). default removes whitespace margins. debug integer specifying whether information printed processing. default, 0, means avoid printing. positive value means print information.  (information vary course evolution code, rely particular behaviour.)

title: Read atmospheric sounding data  readAtmosphericSounding
code: library(atmosphere) file <- system.file("extdata", "Shearwater_2024-07-11.txt.gz", package = "atmosphere") sounding <- readAtmosphericSounding(file)

title: Summarize a sounding  summary
code: library(atmosphere) file <- system.file("extdata", "Shearwater_2024-07-11.txt.gz", package = "atmosphere") sounding <- readAtmosphericSounding(file) summary(sounding) #> Station AWE (#73110 at -63.50E, 44.63N) on 2024-07-11: 11 data and 27 metadata
